quote_a: I admittedly had some reservations about how that would go because I feel like that's one of the integral parts of being interviewed by a humanâ€”being able to pick up on certain details that you might add in, along with certain facial expressions or maybe certain tones, and how that can be leveraged to ask a follow-up question and dive deeper into a particular topic or statement.
quote_b: In certain aspects, it was better than I had thought, especially with some of the follow-up questions that seemed to be prompted based on what I had said in the previous question.
explanation: The participant starts with reservations about AI interviews replacing key human elements, then later says the AI interview performed better than expected with effective follow-up questions.
